item.description:
Welcome the Skills for a New Millenium Tour to Portland! (aka the "Permibus"). You may have seen the Permibus folk at the Common Ground Fair and they've had a chance to take in Maine for a few weeks now. This weekend they will be in Portland and would like to share some of their skills and experience with us!

Both Saturday and Sunday will be 9:30am to 12:30pm followed by sharing some potluck food.

Note that this is going to be happening in West Falmouth at Aaron Parker's place (about 15-20 minutes from downtown Portland). The Bike Barn (on Aaron's dad's property) is technically at 547 Blackstrap but the bus will be parked in Aaron's driveway (the driveway *before* his father's house. Aaron's driveway has a small sign on it that says "scott dugas.").

Park along Blackstrap but don't block the mailboxes!

Cost: Sliding scale donation of $5-25 per session; pay what you can. No one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Please see our Meetup Event RSVP Guidelines:
http://permaculture.m...

If this event is full and you would like to get on the waiting list for an open spot, RSVP "no" with a comment that you'd like to get in...

Please remember to bring your own potluck kit (plate/bowl/utensils/cup/napkin)! Please consider bringing your digital camera a posting up a few photos after the event!

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Permaculture 101 w/Chickens, Greywater and Composting
